entry.title: Do Kwon Reportedly Conducted Crypto Transactions From Prison For More Than 2 Months
entry.summary:
In a developing story surrounding Do Kwon, the co-founder of the collapsed Terraform Labs blockchain, new investigative reports suggest he may have conducted cryptocurrency transactions while in custody in Montenegro.
This revelation follows a lengthy period during which authorities reportedly took 72 days to seize his electronic devices and wallet access codes after his arrest.
Laptops And Crypto Access Codes Found During Prison Search
Local media reports, citing sources from the Special Police Department, indicate that during a search of detainees‚Äô belongings at the prison in Spu≈æ, investigators discovered laptops, mobile phones, and access codes related to virtual wallets and blockchain accounts.¬†

entry.title: Cyprus Sets the Clock for Crypto Firms: October 30 Deadline Looms
entry.summary: Cyprus's financial regulator is giving crypto-asset service providers a narrow window to operate under existing national regulations before new EU-wide rules take effect. The Cyprus Securities and Exchange Commission (CySEC) announced today (Thursday) it will stop accepting notifications from European Economic Area (EEA) firms for cross-border crypto services on October 30, 2024. CySEC Sets October 30 Deadline for Crypto Firms Under National Rules This deadline comes just two months ahead of the Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA) implementation for crypto service providers, set for December 30. Firms that successfully notify CySEC by the October 30 cut-off will be permitted to continue their cross-border operations during a transitional period lasting until July 1, 2026,‚Ä¶

entry.title: There‚Äôs A Proposal To Decentralize Cardano Physical Infrastructure: Will ADA Prices Push Higher?
entry.summary:
Cardano is one of the largest blockchains and among the first to use the proof-of-stake consensus algorithm. While the network has been slipping away from the top 10, it remains one of the most decentralized platforms. Pooltool data shows that Cardano has over 2,800 stake pools (or validators) when writing on October 16.
To maintain this level of decentralization, stake pool operators must run nodes and maintain a high uptime, over 99%, to avoid penalties. This is often achieved using centralized cloud service providers like Google, Amazon, and others.
Developer Proposes To Decentralize Computing Resource Using Physical Infrastructure
A proposal now aims to decentralize the physical computing infrastructure, ensuring that stake pool operators don‚Äôt spend cash on centralized soluti‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ireland Catching Up with EU Deadline: Urgently Drafting Crypto Laws
entry.summary: Irish lawmakers are urgently preparing legislation covering digital assets and crypto firms ahead of the broader European Union‚Äôs anti-money laundering and terror financing laws, set to be enacted on 30 December 2024. According to a report by the Irish Examiner, Ireland‚Äôs Finance Minister, Jack Chambers, has already asked the cabinet to draft this urgent law, as the country needs to update its regulations before the European bloc's deadline. EU Moves Ahead with Crypto Laws The 27-country European bloc‚Äôs Anti-Money Laundering and Countering the Financing of Terrorism Act covers crypto transactions. However, it differs from the Markets in Crypto-Assets Regulation (MiCA), which partially came into effect earlier this year, with its remaining provisions set to be enforced by the end of 2024. W‚Ä¶

entry.title: Hong Kong Police Take Down $46 Million Romance Crypto Scam‚ÄîHere‚Äôs How
entry.summary:
Hong Kong authorities have¬†dismantled a HK$360 million ($46.3 million) cryptocurrency-based romance fraud scheme in a significant crackdown on fraud operations.
This scheme, which targeted individuals over a year, reportedly lured victims into investing in cryptocurrencies under the guise of online romantic relationships.
Detailing The Scheme And The Seizure
The operation, codenamed ‚ÄúSecret Word,‚Äù culminated in the arrest of 27 suspects who allegedly masterminded the fraud and swindled unsuspecting individuals from Hong Kong and other countries, including India, Singapore, and Malaysia.
The Hong Kong police deployed over 100 officers to investigate and conduct an onsite raid, seizing over HK$200,000 ($25,742) in cash, luxury watches, and other valuables.

entry.title: Altcoins bleed, ByBit launches stock index trading, POCHITA soars

Franklin Templeton launch fund on APT. SWIFT banks to trial digital assets in 2025. Aerodrome hits $1bn TVL on Base. Cronje calls out Aerodrome for copyright. ETH ICO wallet sells $47m. SEC files appeal against Ripple ruling. EIGEN falls 20% on staking rewards FUD. FTX to auction off WLD position. Half of US voters think crypto ‚Äòimportant‚Äô. North Korea ‚Äòinfiltrating‚Äô crypto industry. Snowden challenged over SOL centralisation view. Top SEC official on crypto set to depart.

entry.title: DACOM Summit: Fastex CLO Vardan Khachatryan on Crypto Compliance
entry.summary: Fastex Chief Legal Officer Vardan Khachatryan joined Rug Radio creator Mlow at DACOM Summit to discuss how the crypto exchange is advancing compliance, and the regulatory challenges that lie ahead for the sector.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 210 - MIDDLE EAST TENSIONS RISE
entry.summary: Crypto drops as Middle East tensions flare. $500m liquidations in drop. BTC ETFs see largest outflows in a month. Fidelity ETH ETF sees 2nd highest outflow ever. SUI hits 6-month highs, bridge goes live on mainnet. Hashdex set to launch XRP ETF. Wormhole leads altcoin gains after Upbit lists. BTC miners hit record low profits in September Crypto hackers stole $750m in Q3. Telegram has been disclosing IPs since 2018.

entry.title: How Arbitrum is Simplifying Web3 for Web2 Adopters
entry.summary: Arbitrum's Head of Korea, John Park, joined Rug Radio creator Pukerainbow at ArbiVerse to talk about the Ethereum layer-2's strategy in Asia, hackathons, and bringing enterprise clients to its ecosystem.

entry.title: Rep. Tom Emmer Is Confident Crypto Laws Are Coming Soon‚ÄîNo Matter Who Wins the Election
entry.summary: Republican Majority Whip Tom Emmer sat down with Decrypt‚Äôs Sander Lutz and Liz Napolitano to discuss the state of crypto legislation, Kamala Harris, Fairshake, and more at Messari Mainnet 2024.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 209 - LET UPTOBER BEGIN!
entry.summary: BTC ETFs see inflows for 8 straight days. SUI enters top 20, $110m of unlocks today. SOL weekly DEX volume flips ETH. Firedancer sees very fast TPS on Testnet. ETH gas up 500% in 2 weeks. EIGEN opens at $7bn FDV. FTX creditors vote in favour of restructuring plan. Dell to sell another $1.2bn Dell stock. Metaplanet buys another 107 BTC.Grayscale opens decentralised AI fund to investors. Robinhood allows crypto transfer in EU. Pollak to head Coinbase Wallet & join exec team. Gemini to close in Canada. Japan considers lower cap gains tax on crypto. Ohio bill would make it legal to pay taxes in crypto. Trump project opens whitelist to non-US users. CZ pledges to invest in blockchain companies.

entry.title: Binance CEO Richard Teng Talks Progress on Exchange's Global Regulatory Goals
entry.summary: Decrypt Reporters Sander Lutz and Liz Napolitano spoke with Binance CEO Richard Teng about the crypto exchange's progress on establishing a global headquarters, improving its relationships with regulators, and expanding its global presence in the wake of founder Changpeng "CZ" Zhao's jailing in the U.S.
